info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 5:29PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Colleton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 528 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaufort, Port Royal, Ladys Island, Burton, Beaufort Marine Corps Air Station, Shell Point, Parris Island, Laurel Bay, Lemon Island, Calawassie Island, Chesterfield, Beaufort Memorial Hospital, McTeer Memorial Bridge, United States Naval Hospital, Beaufort County Airport, Cat Island, Ashdale, Scott, Daniels and Walling Grove.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
